items.title: A Statue of Trump and Epstein Holding Hands Briefly Appears on the National Mall
items.summary: The United States Park Police said it had removed the statue, which included lines from President Trump’s birthday message to Jeffrey Epstein, the deceased sex offender.

items.title: Here’s the latest.
items.summary: The circumstances of the shooting were not yet clear. Federal authorities said there were “multiple injuries and fatalities.”

items.title: Can the Justice Department Stay Independent Under Trump?
items.summary: The president wants the department to punish his foes and protect his friends.

items.title: Immigration Agents Collected U.S. Citizens’ DNA at Border Checkpoints
items.summary: A report said DNA collected at checkpoints from about 2,000 Americans, mostly during the Biden administration, was sent to an F.B.I. database. Hundreds were not charged.

items.title: The Pentagon, the Press and the Fight to Control National Security Coverage
items.summary: Journalists have long shaped history through scrutiny of the military. Now the Defense Department plans to cut off access for reporters who publish even unclassified information without official approval.

items.title: Under Trump Policy, Bonds for Immigrants Facing Deportation Are Vanishing
items.summary: The president has limited immigration judges’ power to release detainees facing deportation. Immigrant rights groups say the policy is illegal.

items.title: Multiple people shot at Texas Ice office as suspected gunman dies
items.summary: <p>Three people were shot at a Dallas immigration office, officials said, as the suspected gunman died from a self-inflicted wound</p><p>Multiple people were injured at a US <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/usimmigration">Immigration</a> and Customs Enforcement field office in Dallas on Wednesday morning, according to Department of Homeland Security secretary Kristi Noem.</p><p>Law enforcement told <a href="https://www.cnn.com/us/live-news/ice-facility-dallas-shooting-09-24-25?t=1758719549225">CNN</a> that at least two of the victims were Ice detainees. Acting Ice director Todd Lyons told the network that three people were shot and all were taken to the hospital, but did not specify who they were.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/24/dallas-ice-shooting-texas-immigration-center-latest">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Trump says he ‘can’t believe’ Jimmy Kimmel back on ABC; late-night host attacks ‘anti-American’ government’s silencing effort – live
items.summary: <p>President claims without evidence that comedian’s show is an ‘arm of the DNC’; Kimmel says he hadn’t intended to make light of Charlie Kirk’s murder and says Trump ‘did his best to cancel me’</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/2025/sep/24/jimmy-kimmel-says-trump-tried-his-best-to-cancel-him-as-his-show-returns-to-air-after-suspension">Kimmel says silencing comedians is ‘anti-American’</a></p></li></ul><p><strong>The Kremlin on Wednesday brushed off a comment by US president Donald Trump describing Russia as a “paper tiger”, and said president Vladimir Putin valued his efforts to resolve the Ukraine conflict.</strong></p><p>Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said that Russia was a bear, not a tiger, and “there is no such thing as a paper bear”.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/sep/24/donald-trump-jimmy-kimmel-freedom-of-speech-immigration-government-shutdown-us-politics-live-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>
